subject: Sexual Health
title: Age of Consent Laws
description: A micro-lesson that makes Age of Consent Laws usable.

hook.text: The legal age of consent ranges from 12 to 21 across the world. There is no universal agreement.

buildup.text: Most countries set the age between 14 and 18, aiming to protect minors from exploitation.

discovery.text: Close-in-age exemptions, called Romeo and Juliet laws, exist in some places for peers of similar ages.

twist.text: Age of consent laws vary even within a single country. In the US, each state sets its own threshold.

climax.text: These laws balance protecting young people from harm with recognizing their developing autonomy.

punchline.text: The age varies. The need to protect does not.

quiz.question: What is a Romeo and Juliet law?
